body.p: This release note is for the 3.0.0 release. It contains a list of known and fixed issues.

Couchbase Server is a NoSQL document database for interactive web applications. It has a flexible data model, is easily scalable, provides consistent high performance and is “always-on,” meaning it can serve application data 24 hours, 7 days a week.
The new major features in this release include:

ul.li:
Performance
Tunable memory (option to remove keys and metadata from memory).
Bucket disk I/O ejections (for faster persistence to disk).
Faster warm up from disk when restarting the server.

Availability and reliability
Faster XDCR without persisting to disk on the source cluster.
Index building without persisting to disk on the source cluster.

Ease of administration
Incremental backup
Incremental restore

Security
Data and password encryption between client and server
Secure administrator access

section.title: Couchbase .NET incompatibility
section.p: An incompatibility between Microsoft Framework 4.0 or earlier, the Couchbase .NET SDK 1.3.7 or earlier, and Couchbase Server 3.0 has been identified where the URL generated for a View operation on a Bucket is improperly encoded. This causes view requests to fail with the following message in the body:

dlentry.dd: The affected Microsoft .NET versions are 4.0 or earlier, Couchbase .NET SDK 1.3.7 or earlier, and Couchbase Server 3.0 (including Beta) >= 3.0. Microsoft .NET version 4.5 changes the way Uri.ToString handles it’s Unicode encoding, which resolves the issue, thus clients running on that version or higher of the CLR are not impacted. Additionally, Couchbase Server 2.5 and lower are not impacted. Couchbase .NET 1.3.8 has a patch which resolves the issue for all versions of Couchbase Server and Microsoft .NET Frameworks.

In addition to the patch released with Couchbase .NET SDK version 1.3.8, add the following element to your App.Config or Web.Config to enable support for all SDK and Server versions. <uri> <iriParsing enabled="true"/> <uri>
Customers who are not ready or cannot upgrade their Couchbase .NET SDK’s to 1.3.8 or greater are strongly advised to aentry this element to their deployments if they intend to use the Couchbase .NET SDK with Couchbase Server 3.0 or greater.

section.title: Views behavior change
section.p: The stale=false view query argument has been enhanced. It considers all document changes which have been received at the time the query was received. This means that using the durability requirements or observe feature to block for persistence in application code before issuing the falsestale query is no longer needed. It is recommended that you remove all such application level checks after completing the upgrade to the 3.0 release.

Rebalance exit due to Bad Replicas error has no support documentation
A bad replicas error message means that replication streams could not be created. There may be many reasons for this to happen, however, if some of the vBuckets sequence numbers (which are maintained internally in Couchbase) are invalid, the a log message displays in the memcached logs similar to the following:(DCP Producer) some_dcp_stream_name (vb 0) Stream request failed because the snap start seqno (100) <= start seqno (101) <= snap end seqno (100) is required
In order for a DCP producer to accept a request for a DCP stream, the following must be true: snapshot start seqno <= start seqno <= snapshot end seqno
If the above condition is not true for a stream request, contact support to resolve the issue.
